nodes.bodyText: Renaming the channel breaks backward compatibility, but the description remains the same. Is it needed to rename therefor?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1367,7 +1367,7 @@ e.g. `smarthome:send actionCommand 'upd_timer["1498595904821", "on"]'` would ena
 
 | Channel          | Type    | Description                         |
 |------------------|---------|-------------------------------------|
-| vacuumaction     | String  | Vacuum Action                       |
+| dreameControl    | String  | Vacuum Action                       |

nodes.bodyText:
The mean reason for the change is that the type is changing from number to a string... meaning that it will most likely break backwards anyway.
As this type was added very recent (think it is not in 2.5.8) little chance that many users already have this.
nevertheless, I'll change the name back to the earlier channel name and only change the channelType
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1367,7 +1367,7 @@ e.g. `smarthome:send actionCommand 'upd_timer["1498595904821", "on"]'` would ena
 
 | Channel          | Type    | Description                         |
 |------------------|---------|-------------------------------------|
-| vacuumaction     | String  | Vacuum Action                       |
+| dreameControl    | String  | Vacuum Action                       |

nodes.bodyText: If it was not in 2.5.8 it's not officially released yet so we don't consider it a breaking change than.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1367,7 +1367,7 @@ e.g. `smarthome:send actionCommand 'upd_timer["1498595904821", "on"]'` would ena
 
 | Channel          | Type    | Description                         |
 |------------------|---------|-------------------------------------|
-| vacuumaction     | String  | Vacuum Action                       |
+| dreameControl    | String  | Vacuum Action                       |

nodes.bodyText: Does this channel also show the state of the control  or is it only to send commands. In the latter case this should be <command> instead of <state>.

Ah, did not know that.
it is the latter (for now) as it is unclear still how the vacuum is precisely reporting back the current activity.
